intro: Calycadenia truncata, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring. Calycadenia truncata is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
